oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Discharge papers for John George Herman
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John George Herman born in 1841 in Wartenburg, Germany. He became a U.S. resident in 1855. Herman fought as a private under Captain John J. Ball in Co. G, 127th Pa. Regt., USA. He enlisted in Virginia in 1862 and served for 9 months. He was discharged on May 29, 1863, in Harrisburg, Pa. He is described as 21 years of age, 5 feet 10 inches tall, with light complexion and light gray eyes.
